cleaned_text: one of the five forms of [hepatitis](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/hepatitis-panel/health-feed) [infection](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/infection) that is known to afflict the liver. Hepatitis C is one of these infections and is caused by the Hepatitis C virus, also known as [HCV](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/anti-hcv-detection/health-feed). It spreads through the blood of the individual who has been already affected by the disease. The infection can be mild in nature lasting for a few weeks, or severe that causes a lifelong disease. When the infection turns chronic, it can lead to [liver cirrhosis](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/cirrhosis). Hepatitis C is diagnosed through a blood test and though the symptoms are not very clear, the infected individual may experience [fever](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/fever), dark urine, [abdominal pain](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/abdominal-pain), swelling in the legs, fluid accumulation in the abdomen, decreased appetite, [nausea](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/nausea), and muscle or [joint pain](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/joint-pain). As of now, there is no vaccine available to counter hepatitis C but research is underway in this direction. There are allopathic medicines to fight the infection but Ayurvedic remedies are preferred by a good number of people as they do not lead to any side effects and are known to give desirable results in time. So, here are some effective remedies to treat the infection. [Panchakarma](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/panchakarma): Panchakarma, the holistic Ayurvedic detox remedy, is very helpful in curing the inflammation of the liver and it eliminates the pitta dosha, considered to be responsible for causing the infection. It involves five steps and in the first step Abhyanga, the body is given a massage with warm herbal oils. It is followed by [Shirodhara](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/shirodhara), Garshana, Swedana, and Pizichili. In the subsequent steps, medicated oil is poured over the forehead and then the body is rubbed with silk gloves or wool. Later, it is given a steam bath and then a combination of massage and oil pouring is administered. - Andrographis paniculata: Also known as Kalmegh, this herb is a prized liver tonic that is known to carry anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It relaxes the inflamed intestines and gives relief in abdominal pain and fluid accumulation. - Boerhavia diffusa: Also known as [Punarnava](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/punarnava-benefits-and-side-effects), this herb is very effective in controlling the [swelling](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/swelling)and [fluid retention](https://www.lybrate.com/treatment-for-fluid-retention)in the abdomen. It possesses anti-inflammatory action and [diuretic](https://www.lybrate.com/lab-test/anti-diuretic-hormone)properties which relax the liver walls and also flushes out toxins from the body by increasing the flow of urine. - Phyllanthus niruri: Also known as Bhumi Amla, this fruit is very effective in fighting infections of the liver and has the potential to treat all forms of liver diseases. It also carries analgesic, anti-bacterial, and anti-spasmodic properties. It cures the inflammation of the liver and also rectifies the pitta imbalance, which is the primary cause of [liver problems](https://www.lybrate.com/topic/liver-problems)as per [Ayurveda](https://www.lybrate.com/ayurveda). These Ayurvedic remedies are a reliable and rich treatment method and can cure the liver infection from the root. The herbal medicines can be taken in any form and they work in all stages of hepatitis C but it is always advised to consult a credible Ayurveda practitioner before going for any of these remedies. A thorough diagnosis is a must before prescription of appropriate remedies and treats the infection.
